explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value of 275mg/kg calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 1,143mg/kg, 315mg/kg, 327mg/kg, 930mg/kg and 208mg/kg (SIDS (2005)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of 5,000mg/kg (SIDS (2005)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the LC50 value of 0.0911mg/L calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of dust) of 0.17mg/L (SIDS (2005)), 0.086mg/L (SIDS (2005)) and 0.201mg/L (SIDS(2005)).

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description of rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hour application) (CERI Hazard Data 2000-55 (2001) and SIDS (2005)): "irritating to the skin," though the severity of the effects is unknown. Although classified into Category 2-3, the substance should be placed in Category 2 from the viewpoint of safety.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the data on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-55 (2001) and (SIDS (2005)) and human health effects (CERI Hazard Data 2000-55 (2001)): "severely irritating." Although classified into Category 1-2A, the substance should be placed in Category 1 from the viewpoint of safety.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the description in the report on skin sensitization studies in animals (CERI Hazard Data 2000-55 (2001) and SIDS (2005)): "skin sensitization: positive."

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests, germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in SIDS (2005) and CERI Hazard Data 2000-55 (2001).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of a slight increase in postimplantation loss at doses causing parental toxicity in rat teratogenicity studies, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory organs, nervous system), Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "the occurrence of pulmonary edema 2-3 hours after inhalation of vapour or fume," "purulent bronchitis" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), and the evidence from animal studies including "hypokinesis, lethargy, hypomyotonia, loss of reflex, cyanosis, gait disorder, reduced reflex, swelling and edema in the lung with secretion of mucus, and hydropneumothorax" (SIDS (2001)).The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory organs, liver, spleen, blood system, kidneys, heart)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "irritation of the upper and lower respiratory tracts, occurrence of bronchitis and bronchial pneumonia" (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004)), and the evidence from animal studies including "histological changes in the liver/spleen/lung, decreased RBC/hemoglobin/hematocrit levels," "reduced RBC, decreased hemoglobin levels, interstitial pneumonia, degeneration of the liver/kidneys/myocardium, and bronchial pneumonia in a fatal case" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-55 (2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Not classified from 24 hours EC50>1000mg/L (the crustacea (Daphnia magna)) of cyanuric ester(hydrolysis product of this product) (SIDS (2005) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since it was not water-insolubility (the water-solubility =400.8mg/L (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), and acute toxicity was low, it was classified into Not classified.
